name: InstallPython
description: Installs one or more Python versions into your build environment
author: Steve Dower

inputs.name: versions
inputs.label: Version pack
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a set of versions to install.

inputs.name: prerelease
inputs.label: Install prerelease versions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Allow prerelease versions of Python to be installed.

inputs.name: versionlist
inputs.label: Versions
inputs.helpMarkDown: List of specific versions to install, e.g. `python==3.5.2;python==3.6.0`. If specified, the version pack option is ignored.

inputs.name: outputdir
inputs.label: Install Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Folder where packages will be installed. By default, `$(Build.BinariesDirectory)` will be used.

inputs.name: nuGetAdditionalArgs
inputs.label: NuGet Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional arguments passed to NuGet.exe pack. [More Information](https://docs.nuget.org/consume/command-line-reference#user-content-pack-command).

inputs.name: nuGetPath
inputs.label: Path to NuGet.exe
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the path to NuGet.exe

inputs.name: nuGetSource
inputs.label: Source URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the NuGet source to obtain the packages from.

inputs.name: clean
inputs.label: Clean existing installs
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally delete all python* directories in the output
